title: Looking for the Magnificat font
content:
Hello I need help on as finding files of the calligraphic typography ” Magnificat “, I found a connection to one it paginates in this forum but it seems to be one it paginates of japan and I don’t understand of where to lower information of the typography, neither you if it is a file TTF,EPS. or a file AI.  
please help me to find the file Thank you!!
author: universalpenman

comments.content: Here is the [Google cache](http://web.archive.org/web/20090624011306/http:/www.google.com/search?q=cache:nFYKa0E0oCcJ:www.typophile.com/cgibin/discus.pl%3Fpg%3Dnext%26topic%3D83%26page%3D11285+site:typophile.com+Magnificat&hl=en) of the thread in question.

:S Excuses my ignorance but I didn’t understand neither with the translator that that me quiziste to say wants to believe that you left me a connection to one it paginates to discharge the file SIT. but it doesn’t send me to any side I wait you can finish helping :P, neither I hope it is “sarcazmo” joke and you are leaving me a connection to Google to begin a search ¬¬

I’m sorry, here’s a better link: [http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/10546.html?1054374673](http://web.archive.org/web/20090624011306/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/10546.html?1054374673 "http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/10546.html?1054374673")

You can also find a copy of this font at

[Link removed by Moderator.]

Regards!

I might have acted hastily. I apologize. This seems to still be a questionable issue.

[Using wayback](http://web.archive.org/web/20090624011306/http:/web.archive.org/web/20041108193240/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/10546.html?1054374673) you can read the thread Stephen just linked to.

The thread doesn’t seem to answer if a free version of this typeface is legal or not.

links:  
 [http://typophile.com/node/73](http://web.archive.org/web/20090624011306/http:/typophile.com/node/73 "http://typophile.com/node/73")  
 [http://typophile.com/node/10276](http://web.archive.org/web/20090624011306/http:/typophile.com/node/10276 "http://typophile.com/node/10276")  
 [http://typophile.com/node/7846](http://web.archive.org/web/20090624011306/http:/typophile.com/node/7846 "http://typophile.com/node/7846")

i’ve started on a digitization of Magnificat myself, but i’m not sure it’s leagal to distribute it.

I think that: a copy of a banknote is legal if the worlds FAX-SIMILE is printed on... So a copy of a painting. And so any copy (remade, not a simple copy-paste) of a font.  
Furthermore and above all, it is not a commercial font.
well i guess i should have said i’m not sure it’s _ethical_ to distribute it.

Interesting point of view.  
About that, I want to clarify that in my page I indicate the name of the real author and even in the font file (TTF) is specified that the designer was Friedrich Peter.
